en: Would’ve still been alive… if not for one sodding fly.
Still… since you’re here. Might as well make yourself useful.
Hobson Crane. Most talented alchemist this world’s ever seen. Or was. Not planning to stay this way.
So. Don’t just stand there gawping. The grimoire’s right there.
You do know how to read… right?
Hah. Thought so. But don’t go pawing at it just yet.
And fetch the spoon. Can’t stir a potion with your bare hands… unless you fancy joining me in this mess.
“Clockwise to make. Counterclockwise to break. Even you should manage that.”
“First, a simple test. That scroll on the table. Pick it up. If you can manage that without setting the place on fire… maybe you’re worth trusting with the real work.”
“Not bad. You’ve passed the grand test of picking up paper. Congratulations. You’re practically a scholar. Now… follow along with the recipe.”
“First… Wild Lavender. Pick it up and drop it in. Try not to confuse the cauldron with your own head.”
“Well done. You’ve mastered basic herb chucking.”
“Now… Whisper Shell. And mind you don’t break it. Or do. I don’t care.”
Next comes stirring. Clockwise. You do know your clock faces… right?
“Hah. Wasn’t sure you’d get that one.”
“Now throw some firewood on the hearth. No fire, no brew. Shocking, I know.”
“Good. Now… Paper Shred. In the pot. Before you forget what we’re doing.”
“And one last bit of firewood. Unless you fancy serving up a cold sludge.”
“There. Wasn’t so hard, was it? Now keep to that order… unless you fancy starting over.”
“Hmph. Didn’t expect you to get that right. Maybe you’re worth letting near the grimoire after all.”
Hmph. Would’ve been done hours ago… if I’d done it myself.
Should’ve brewed a patience potion while I was at it.
Clockwise. It’s not difficult. Even a turnip could manage it.
Tch. I said stir, not stand there gawping like a halfwit.
Rule one. Always know what you’re adding… before you add it.
Oh. Another pebble. How thrilling… Wait. No. It’s a seed. Typical. Useless.
“Every fool thinks they’re an alchemist… right up until they explode.”
“Lavender’s a fair old thing for keeping the mind quiet. Had a PocketPuff by the bed once… before I gave up sleeping.”
“They say if you listen close, you’ll hear the sea. I hear my patience giving out. That’s why it finds its way into Tattle Tonic and Bat’s Bother. Can’t trust anything else to behave.”
“Funny thing about invisibility… apparently any scrap of old paper’ll do the job. Got the stuff clogging up every corner, and now it’s making potions? Ridiculous.”
“Takes a pebble to speed up your hands. Obvious, right? No. No, it isn’t.”
